item.description:
Escape from Winter! Go to the Boston Flower & Garden Show!
I always try to go to the Boston flower show. I don't even have a yard so no garden, but I just love seeing all the creative designs, buying a few indoor plants, and briefly escaping from winter. And if you have a garden to plan for this spring/summer, then you'll have even more fun. (Be sure to bring your camera / video recorder because there will be lots of great photo opportunities.) Please Note: I've cross-posted this event in the "Fun & Fabulous 40/50-Something Women" Meet-up Group. This should be a lot of fun!

This year's theme: "A Burst of Color: Celebrating the Container Garden"

Website: http://www.paragonexpo.com/index.php/BFS-General/
Container gardening has exploded out of the humble window box to become the hottest way to add vibrancy, warmth, and drama to any size space – a sunny welcome on a city terrace, a gourmet harvest in a suburban side yard, or a fresh focal point for a mature landscape. This year’s show will focus on this popular trend by mixing examples of the endless creative possibilities of containers into all of its gardens and special displays.

  • Each garden will feature at least one significant container of some kind (formal urns, topiary, raised beds, built-in planters, ceramics, vertical gardens, unusual items re-purposed as containers).
  • A non-judged Invitational Display will feature container entries by invited Professional Florists & Interior Landscapers.
  • "Contain Yourself!" This series of daily hands-on workshops will offer instruction and a take-home container project for participants (additional fee).

In addition to these elements, you’ll find hundreds of new products to buy, over 48 hours of lectures and demonstrations, cutting edge designs by professional florists and the region's top amateur floral arrangers and horticulturists assembled in a vibrant display by the Massachusetts Horticultural Society and the Garden Club Federation of Massachusetts Inc.

Lunch: There is food at the show - a restaurant and some snack bars.

Admission: $20, Seniors (65+) $17
PLEASE NOTE: You are responsible for buying your own ticket -- either online, at one of the merchants listed below or at the front door (but I'd suggest getting there early due to the lines).

Purchase tickets now on the show website to avoid lines at the door. Tickets are also available by visiting these local merchants:

  • Brooks Bound Nursery, Westminster, MA
  • Corliss Bros. Garden Center, Ipswich, MA
  • Kennedy's Country Gardens, Scituate, MA
  • New England Nurseries, Bedford, MA
  • Stobbart's Nursery, Franklin, MA
  • Wilson Farm, Lexington, MA
  • Plus, all Roche Bros. Supermarkets

Directions & Parking: http://www.paragonexpo.com/index.php/BFS-General/directions.html

Carpooling: If you are interested in carpooling with some of other people going to this event, you might wish to mention that in your RSVP so that you could try to coordinate that with the others traveling from a little further away. (I live in Arlington near Boston and don't have a car so I'll just be taking the T into Boston.)

MBTA: http://www.mbta.com/...
